The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.

Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?

Comments_List: I learned so much about grammar (sentence structure, vocabulary, tenses, phrases etc.)
My grammar and confidence with the language increased a lot.
Learned a lot about in depth grammar of the spanish language.

This course helped strengthen my Spanish language skills, particularly that of my written Spanish. Before taking this course, I had felt confident in my spoken Spanish, but not so much in my written, which was ridden with grammar errors and incorrect gender agreement. After taking this course, I feel much more confident in my written Spanish, as well as my spoken.
I learned a lot of the nuances of Spanish grammar.
I developed my knowledge of Spanish grammar, including my reading, writing, and speaking skills.

You learn so much about grammar, and you leave the class feeling like your Spanish has improved dramatically. The downside is that there is A LOT of work, and it often feels like busy work. Also, the exams are hard to do exceedingly well at since there are so many small mistakes that you can make.
it is very involved and causes you to thing hard about concepts you are not comfortable with.

Strengths: the small class size, the constant homework to reinforce class discussion, the availability of the professor. Weaknesses: the course is fairly fast-paced and builds off of previous material, so it can be easy to get lost.
There are a lot of assignments and sometimes they can be a bit too much.
This was an excellent course. I do not have any major suggestions for improvements.
Take this class if you're looking for an L5 credit and are not that great at speaking Spanish.
Would definitely recommend if you're looking to increase your command of the Spanish language. Prof Asensio is great also
yes I would recommend it to anyone who wants to improve their spanish

If you are interested in improving your written Spanish or are interested in taking higher-level Spanish courses, I highly recommend taking this course as a foundation for future use of the language. It provides you with the necessary building blocks of Spanish to be able to practice the language and become more fluent while using correct grammar.
Only if they are looking for a way to get back into Spanish without diving right into the other more challenging level 5 courses.
This is a good course for students interested in developing their knowledge of Spanish grammar.
